job_tasks.phrase: You will work on our M365 Copilot Scale-up project.

job_tasks.justification: This relates to managing project progress and team alignment, common in software development execution.

job_tasks.phrase: You'll lead tasks efficiently, solve problems as they come up, and work closely with the team and stakeholders.
job_tasks.justification: This covers task leadership, problem-solving, and collaboration, all integral to software development execution.

job_tasks.phrase: You'll need to adapt to changes and make sure all deliverables meet the required standards.
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the need for adaptability and ensuring quality, which are standard software engineering practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Define strategy and governance for M365 Copilot and SharePoint Online.

job_tasks.justification: User stories are a fundamental part of the software development process, particularly in Agile methodologies.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement M365 Copilot and SharePoint solutions and advise on data control
job_tasks.justification: This involves the practical implementation of solutions and providing guidance on data aspects, which are core to integrating and developing systems.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop and maintain services to extend the M365 platform.
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly states the development and maintenance of services, a core software engineering activity.

job_tasks.phrase: Advise end-users on the efficient use of Microsoft 365 tools according to the bank's guidelines.
job_tasks.justification: This involves guiding users on how to leverage existing tools effectively within organizational constraints, linking technical capabilities to business usage.

profile.rationale: The job description emphasizes traditional software engineering tasks such as developing and maintaining services, implementing solutions, participating in DevOps user stories, and managing projects. While it involves 'M365 Copilot,' the tasks described (strategy, implementation, advising on use, technical readiness) focus on integrating and scaling this AI feature within the existing Microsoft 365 platform, rather than core AI model development, fine-tuning, or advanced prompt engineering. This aligns with the definition of an 'AI-Adjacent Software Engineer' who builds or maintains software that directly uses or supports AI/ML models as a core part of its functionality.

confidence.reasoning: The job ad is quite clear about the responsibilities and the technologies involved (Microsoft 365 ecosystem, Copilot). The tasks are well-defined within the context of platform engineering and integration. The only slight ambiguity is the depth of 'AI' involvement, but the description leans heavily towards integration and platform extension rather than core AI research or development. This makes the 'AI-Adjacent Software Engineer' profile a strong fit.
